medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp, non-radiating right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain for 3 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's RUQ pain began 3 days ago and has been consistent. It is associated with fevers, chills (rigors), severe nausea, and 1 episode of bilious vomiting. Denies diarrhea. The last bowel movement and flatus were ___ days ago, but the patient notes that is normal.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Biliary stent placement, history of 2 cesarean sections.
